list_definition.definition: to put in place ready for use

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When was the telephone/electricity installed (in this house)?

list_definition.definition: to put (a thing, oneself or another person) in a place or position

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was installed as president yesterday
They soon installed themselves in the new house.

list_ex_of_english: Accordingly, no consideration is being given to the legal implications of installing and using any such device.
We are installing expensive machinery for cleaning the coal.
Additional directional signs of the normal motorway pattern are now being installed, after which it is proposed to remove the present temporary signs.
Secondly, we need a much more reliable permanent remote controlled warning light system for accidents and adverse weather conditions, and this should be installed.
The machine is worth installing only if it works all day.
The new fittings that have been installed are a special type of fluorescent bulb, which works on a high frequency induction principle.
During the past year an increasing number of amenities have been installed aboard ship.
Burglar alarm systems are regarded as suitable for domestic use if they are of a kind installed in private houses or similar premises.
